document_data.name: Porklet
document_data.author: [[Archibald Ravenshade]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Porklet''''' was a play penned by a famed [[half-elven]] poet and playwright [[Archibald Ravenshade]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: ''Porklet'' was a story about an irresolute man who wrestled with a decision to murder his evil uncle.
document_data.History: As of the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, ''Porklet'' was immortalized in the form of a painting by [[Oskar Fevras]]. The image, painted in the late 15{{th}} century DR, depicted Archibald Ravenshade, surrounded by two of the [[Vanthampur]] brothers, as the half-elf unveiled a review of a theatrical production of ''Porklet''. The painting, simply named ''The Vanthampur Brothers'', was stored in Oskar's studio in Lady [[Wisteria Jannath]]'s [[Lower City]] manse.
